transcript: marry till you can say to yoursel f that you have done all you are capa- ble of, and until you have ceased to love the woman of your choice and have seen her plain- ly as she is, or else you will make a cruel and irrevocable mistake. Marry when you are old and good for nothing or all that is good and noble in you will be lost. It will all be wasted on trifles. Yes! Yes! Yes! Don't look at me with such surprise.
